image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: a Representative from Missouri; born in Perryville, Perry County, Mo., November 25, 1869; attended the public schools; engaged in the retail lumber business and also in road construction; mayor of Perryville 1900-1902; member of the Missouri state house of representatives 1902-1908; delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1912; served on the staff of Gov. Arthur M. Hyde 1920-1924; elected as a Republican to the Sixty-ninth Congress (March 4, 1925-March 3, 1927); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1926 to the Seventieth Congress; elected to the Seventy-first Congress (March 4, 1929-March 3, 1931); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1930 to the Seventy-second Congress; resumed the lumber and banking business in Perryville, Mo., until his death on December 13, 1942; interment in Home Cemetery.

asset.name: K000167_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

researchRecord.name: 1925-1931, 4 cubic feet (160 folders).
researchRecord.description: Collection includes personal and congressional papers, including subject files, post office files, and veterans' concerns. A finding aid is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: Joint Collection, University of Missouri Western Historical Manuscript Collection-Rolla and State Historical Society of Missouri Manuscripts
